Name: Blücher
Fate: Sunk by Norwegian coastal defence batteries in the Battle of Drøbak Sound on 9 April 1940
Propulsion:
3 × Blohm & Voss steam turbines
3 × three-blade propellers
Armament:
8 × 20.3 cm (8.0 in) guns
12 × 10.5 cm (4.1 in) SK C/33 guns
12 × 3.7 cm (1.5 in) SK C/30 guns
8 × 2 cm (0.79 in) C/30 guns (20 × 1)
6 × 53.3 cm (21 in) torpedo tubes
Armor:
Belt:         70 to 80 mm (2.8 to 3.1 in)
Armor deck:   20 to 50 mm (0.79 to 1.97 in)
Turret faces: 105 mm (4.1 in)
